item.title: C&S Brisket Bus
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
This is the Tex-Mex from the C&S Brisket Bus. It’s super tender brisket, cheddar cheese, jalapeños, on toast. It’s dead simple yet utterly delicious. So good, in fact, that I forgot to take the picture until I had already eaten half of the sandwich. The Brisket Bus guys know what they’re doing. Follow them on […]

The post C&S Brisket Bus appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
This is the Tex-Mex from the C&S Brisket Bus. It’s super tender brisket, cheddar cheese, jalapeños, on toast. It’s dead simple yet utterly delicious. So good, in fact, that I forgot to take the picture until I had already eaten half of the sandwich.

The Brisket Bus guys know what they’re doing. Follow them on Twitter and find out where they’re parked.

The post C&S Brisket Bus appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: C&S Brisket Bus
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
When it comes to blue cheese, I’ve learned that you either love it or hate it; there’s basically no middle ground. I, for one, am a fan, especially when it’s paired with a nice red meat. They seem made for each other. Maybe they are. Either way, when I saw the Black and Blue on […]

The post C&S Brisket Bus appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
When it comes to blue cheese, I’ve learned that you either love it or hate it; there’s basically no middle ground. I, for one, am a fan, especially when it’s paired with a nice red meat. They seem made for each other. Maybe they are. Either way, when I saw the Black and Blue on the menu at the C&S Brisket Bus, I was in.

The Black and Blue is a nice beef brisket sandwich with lettuce, tomato and blue cheese aioli on a soft brioche bun. The brisket is so tender, it basically melts when eaten. This, combined with the creamy aioli with the slight bite of the blue cheese makes for a very nice sandwich.

You can follow the C&S Brisket Bus on twitter.

The post C&S Brisket Bus appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
